alert.note: Alert for Big Stone (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 10:01AM CDT until April 24 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota...Minnesota... Minnesota River near Big Stone Lake affecting Big Stone, Grant and Roberts Counties. Minnesota River at Ortonville affecting Big Stone County. .For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River Big Stone Lake. * WHEN...Until Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 971.5 feet, Parks are flooded along Big Stone Lake. Water reaches several homes on the Ortonville peninsula. At 971.6 feet, Water reaches shoreline homes on Shady Oak Drive. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 972.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 AM CDT Wednesday was 972.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon and continue falling to 971.2 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 971.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Thursday evening by 615 PM CDT.
